en: Honeymoon phase depleted; teammates reveal their true nature
Make your choice. But remember: in this world good intentions often backfire.
Watch your Reality score. When it drops to 0 the game is over.
The prayer system lets you input positive wishes... then watch them turn into disasters.
Congratulations on completing your first mission! Check the journal for story details.
Skill checks are based on your abilities. Improving skills unlocks more options.
Gloria's moral blackmail has arrived! Complaining too much triggers her intervention.
Rising entropy means the world is accelerating toward collapse. This is the price of 'saving the world'.
During the night you can explore teammate relationships or engage in self-reflection.
Reach Reality Score of 80 or higher
Pray to the Flying Spaghetti Monster 10 times
Keep both Reality and Positive Energy between 40-60
Face and resolve your first moral dilemma
Resolve 10 moral dilemmas and become complicit in the disasters
Record your observations and doubts or choose preset responses.
Create a new mission scenario for the player.
The Flying Spaghetti Monster has heard your prayer... maybe.

keys: # Trolley Problem Dilemma - Team Strategy Discussion

en: The team is discussing strategy. Gloria proposes an optimistic plan but ARK points out its logical flaws.
ğŸŒŸ Support Gloria's optimistic plan and stay positive.
Team feels better and Gloria gains confidence.
Plan fails due to logical flaws but team stays positive missing improvement opportunities.
âš–ï¸ Support ARK's critical analysis and face reality.
Gloria feels criticized and team morale drops.
Team learns critical thinking but may strain relationship with Gloria.
Sometimes honesty is punished while toxic positivity is rewarded.
I feel frustrated. No matter how logically I plan, the team still ruins everything.
I feel hopeless. Can this world even be saved? Positive-energy dogma has already wrecked it all.
I'm furious. Why won't anyone face reality? Why is admitting the problem so hard?
I'm confused. Positive-energy thinking causes so much disaster, yet people still believe in it.
I'm exhausted. Fighting these absurd catastrophes every day is draining me dry.
